article.headline: Drake 87, Georgia Southern 75
article.story: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) -- Ajay Calvin scored a career-high 24 points to help Drake beat Georgia Southern 87-75 in the championship game of the Drake Regency Classic on Saturday night. Calvin was selected the Outstanding Player on the tournament's six-man team. He was joined by Bulldogs teammate Josh Young and James Hughes from Northern Illinois, O'Darien Bassett from Troy, and Dwayne Foreman and Louis Graham from Georgia Southern. Calvin hit 10 of 13 from the field and played a key role in a deciding scoring run, which saw Drake (5-2) pull away for their fourth straight win. Donte Gennie scored 18 points followed by Foreman with 15 and Graham with 14 for Georgia Southern (5-3). Young finished with 19 points and Nick Grant added 14 for the Bulldogs. With Drake clinging to a 68-64 lead with 8:30 left, the Bulldogs went on a 13-4 run for an 81-68 margin with 4:32 remaining. Calvin and Korver each had four points during the spurt. The Eagles shot 51 percent from the field. Drake's victory broke a four-game winning streak by Georgia Southern. The game saw six ties and nine lead changes before the Bulldogs broke the game open late in the second half. Drake hosts UC Irvine on Tuesday night.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
